insurer_name: Aviva Insurance Limited (for Sections 1-5), ARAG Legal Expenses Insurance Company Limited (for Section 6 - Legal Expenses). Underwritten by Prestige Underwriting Services Limited. Arranged and administered by Pikl Insurance Services Ltd
policy_type: Property Host Insurance - Short-term rental/hosting insurance (90 Days policy)
coverage_summary: Insurance designed to work alongside an existing Property Policy to provide additional cover when undertaking hosting activities. Covers property damage, contents damage, loss of income, liability, and legal expenses arising from guests or visitors during valid bookings. Maximum period of 90 days. Cover is only valid during Valid Bookings and requires an existing annual Property Policy to be in place.
key_inclusions: Buildings (Insured Property) or Flat/Apartment Structure damage caused by guests/visitors or hosting activity
Fire, smoke and explosion up to £1,000,000 (or £50,000 for flats)
Accidental damage and malicious damage up to £80,000 (£50,000 for flats)
Escape of water or heating oil up to £1,000,000 (£50,000 for flats)
Theft or attempted theft up to £20,000
Contents damage including valuables and electrical valuables
Alternative accommodation for host and family if property uninhabitable (up to £200/day, max £20,000)
Alternative accommodation for guests (up to £150/day, max £5,000)
Key theft and lock replacement (up to £1,000)
Loss of income following a claim (up to £10,000)
Electric and hybrid charging point damage (up to £1,500)
Fatal bodily injury to insured (up to £10,000)
Pest infestation damage and fumigation (up to £1,000)
key_exclusions: COMMUNICABLE DISEASE - Any loss, damage, claim or liability arising from communicable diseases including COVID-19
Deposit amounts - Where deposit exceeds claim value or Policy excess
Claims where no Valid Booking exists
Claims where existing Property Policy would cover if this policy didn't exist (except amounts exceeding Property Policy limits)
Claims where cover not in place before guests arrive
Cosmetic damage only (scratches, marks, dents where functionality not affected)
Domestic pet damage (chewing, scratching, tearing, fouling)
Wear and tear, gradual damage, mould, rot, rust
Damage caused by policyholder, host, host's family, or permanent residents
Valuable items: guns, sports equipment, scuba equipment, audio/visual software, cash, credit cards, vouchers
External walls and roofs of flats/apartments
Claims for guests who are tenants/leasees (not short-term guests)
Liability for deliberate or criminal acts
Liability for food or drink provision
Liability for theft of guest/visitor property
Liability from charging point improper installation/maintenance
Liability from charging point product recalls
Liability from motorised vehicles, e-bikes, aircraft, watercraft, drones
Liability from dangerous animals or specially controlled dogs
Liability for pollution (unless sudden and accidental)
Legal expenses for assault, violence, dishonesty, defamation
Legal expenses for money laundering, bribery, fraud, financial crimes
Legal expenses for group litigation orders
Renovations - No guests allowed during renovation/structural alterations

coverage_limits.Valuables and Electrical Valuables: £20,000 per claim total, £5,000 single item limit
coverage_limits.Legal expenses: £50,000 per claim (all related claims count as one)

sub_limits.Loss of income - 14 day exclusion: No cover for first 14 complete days after insured event

special_conditions: CRITICAL: Must have valid annual Property Policy in place for entire Period of Insurance
Must have Valid Booking with cover in place BEFORE guests arrive
Must notify insurer of short-term letting to Property Policy provider within 30 days
Must have written agreement with guests (or verbal agreement for family/friends)
Maximum 20 people (10 adults/10 children) at any one time
Multiple instances during one Valid Booking treated as single incident (single excess)
Must retain full deposit paid by guest
Must report theft/malicious damage to police immediately and obtain crime reference number
Must provide evidence of ownership and proof of loss/damage during Valid Booking
Must allow insurer access to inspect damage
Must not dispose of damaged items or make permanent repairs before inspection
Must take reasonable precautions to prevent damage
Property must be well maintained and in good state of repair
Must provide adequate instructions to guests on property use
Property must be equipped with essential items for modern living
Must comply with local authority regulations and fire safety regulations
Must have valid gas safety certificate if required
No guests allowed during renovations/structural alterations
Insurer may require claim submission to Property Policy first
Insurer may require barrister's opinion to resolve disputes
For Legal Expenses: Must use insurer's appointed advisor unless conflict of interest or proceedings issued
excess_deductible: £100 excess applies to most claims. Specific excesses: £100 for fire/smoke/explosion, £100 for accidental/malicious damage, £100 for theft, £100 for emergency services damage, £100 for key theft, £100 for alternative accommodation, £100 for contents, £100 for pest infestation, £100 for liability claims. No excess mentioned for loss of income or legal expenses (except £100 minimum claim value for legal expenses).
geographical_coverage: United Kingdom including Northern Ireland. Property must be located in UK (excluding Channel Islands for property location). Legal Expenses: Territorial Limits are United Kingdom. Some legal advice covers UK, Isle of Man, Channel Islands and EU law.
age_restrictions: No specific age restrictions for policyholder mentioned. Fatal bodily injury cover applies to insured persons without age restrictions stated.
pre_existing_conditions: Not applicable for this property insurance. However, for Personal Injury claims under Legal Expenses: excludes conditions, illness or disease which develops gradually or over time; excludes mental injury without physical bodily injury.
cancellation_policy: Statutory cancellation rights: 14 days from purchase date or receipt of policy documents (whichever later) for full refund unless claim made or incident occurred. After 14 days: no refund, all outstanding premiums become due. Insurer may cancel with 14 days notice for valid reasons including: non-payment, threatening/abusive behaviour, failure to provide documents, non-compliance with terms, fraud.

endorsements.name: No specific endorsements listed
endorsements.description: Policy schedule may contain endorsements that modify terms
endorsements.coverage_impact: Endorsements would be detailed on policy schedule

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as reasonably possible and no later than 30 days from discovery of incident or event that might lead to a claim. Police must be informed IMMEDIATELY for theft or malicious damage.
required_documents: Full details of loss or damage
Pre and post letting inspection reports
Proof that guest/visitor damage occurred during Valid Booking
Written evidence from Property Policy provider of their decision (if required)
Proof that full deposit retained from guest
Proof of booking for loss of income claims
For liability: any claim form, application notice, legal document or correspondence from claimant
process_steps: 1. Contact insurer immediately upon discovery - no later than 30 days
2. For theft/malicious damage: report to police immediately and obtain crime reference number
3. Provide policy number and full details of loss
5. Take reasonable steps to minimize loss and prevent further damage
6. Do NOT dispose of damaged items or make permanent repairs
7. Do NOT admit liability or negotiate with third parties
8. Allow insurer access to inspect damage
9. Obtain estimates for repairs if requested
10. Provide all requested documentation and evidence
11. Cooperate fully with insurer and appointed advisors
12. Keep insurer updated on claim progress
13. Insurer may require claim submission to Property Policy provider first
14. For Legal Expenses: use insurer's appointed advisor unless conflict of interest
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Police crime reference number for theft/malicious damage (mandatory). Evidence of ownership (receipts). Proof of Valid Booking. Letting history. Pre/post inspection reports. Photographs of damage. Written agreement with guest. Proof that damage occurred during valid booking period. Evidence that full deposit retained. For loss of income: contractual written agreement of booking made before insured event. For liability: documentation showing insured's legal responsibility.
claims_requirements.claims_contact: 24 Hour New Claims Hotline: 0800 032 7327. Online: www.prestigeunderwriting.co.uk/claims. Post: Prestige Underwriting, 4th Floor, Lanyon Building, North Derby Street, Belfast, BT15 3HL. For Legal Expenses claims: Tel 0117 917 1698 or www.arag.co.uk/newclaims

eligibility_criteria.age_limits: No specific age limits stated for policyholder
eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Policy designed for hosting activity only - not for business activities except hosting
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be UK or Isle of Man resident (excludes Channel Islands)
other_restrictions: Must be property owner or have legal responsibility for property
Must have valid annual Property Policy in place
Must inform Property Policy provider of hosting activity within 30 days
Property must be well maintained and in good state of repair
Property located in UK (including Northern Ireland)
Property not Grade 1 listed (England/Wales) or Grade A listed (Scotland/NI)
Property not thatched or part-thatched roof
Less than 20 people staying at any one time
No more than 2 property/host insurance claims in last 12 months or 3 in last 5 years
Never cautioned, convicted or charged with criminal offences (except spent convictions and motoring offences)
Operating in compliance with local authority regulations and laws
Written permission from landlord if tenant acting as host
Must agree to provide/allow access to letting history

policy_definitions.Valid Booking: A property rental booking for a guest for an agreed period of time. Critical: cover must be in place BEFORE guests arrive.
policy_definitions.Guest: Person(s) including family/travelling companions who host has agreed may stay at insured premises for agreed period under written short let agreement, OR family/friends staying for agreed period without charge (verbal agreement acceptable for family/friends)
policy_definitions.Visitor: Person present at insured premises due to invitation/actions of Guest, not included in written short let agreement
policy_definitions.Host: Person(s) or company named on policy schedule who have agreed to allow guests onto their property
policy_definitions.Hosting Activity: Any activity performed to fulfil host's legal obligations under written short let agreement or verbal agreement with family/friends
policy_definitions.Insured Premises: The insured property or flat/apartment owned by you or for which you are legally responsible, let with landlord's permission, and registered under this policy
policy_definitions.Property Policy: A property insurance policy including cover for damage when NOT being used for hosting (flood, storm, subsidence, escape of water, fire, smoke, theft, liability to others)
policy_definitions.Deposit: Amount collected from guest intended to cover potential loss/damage during Valid Booking
policy_definitions.Period of Insurance: The period shown on policy schedule
policy_definitions.Accidental Damage: Accidental sudden and unintentional loss/destruction/damage to host's property
policy_definitions.Malicious Damage: Any act of intended damage to insured premises or contents
policy_definitions.Theft: Any act of fraud or dishonesty with clear intent of obtaining improper financial gain
policy_definitions.Bodily Injury: Death or physical injury caused by sudden unexpected external visible event
policy_definitions.Contents: Household items including valuables, electrical valuables, personal belongings inside insured premises (garages, outbuildings, gardens) which you own or are responsible for. Excludes vehicles, charging points, documents, pets
policy_definitions.Valuables: Jewellery, watches, precious gems/stones, bullion, gold/silver plated articles, precious metals, furs, pictures, paintings, works of art
policy_definitions.Electrical Valuables: Tablets, laptops, phones, home computers, monitors, satellite decoders, audio/video equipment
policy_definitions.Fixtures and Fittings: Built-in furniture/appliances, fixed glass, sanitary ware, external lighting, alarms, surveillance equipment, fixed pipes/ducts/wires/cables, tanks, heating equipment, ground source heat pumps, floor coverings, balconies/terraces, hot tubs, saunas
policy_definitions.Charging Point: Hybrid or electric vehicle charging unit including connections/cables
policy_definitions.Loss of Income: Amount of monetary benefit host would have received from guest for hosting activity excluding third party fees/commission
policy_definitions.Reasonable Costs: Costs for goods/services which are competitive in relevant marketplace
policy_definitions.Reasonable Prospects of Success (Legal E: Greater than 50% chance of successfully pursuing or defending claim and enforcing any judgment. For contract disputes: >50% chance of successfully defending in entirety. For appeals: >50% chance of success
policy_definitions.Communicable Disease: ANY disease transmissible by any substance/agent from organism to organism, including viruses, bacteria, parasites; transmission by any method including airborne, bodily fluid, surface/object contact; includes COVID-19 and all coronaviruses, all pandemics

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: Loss of income claims: no cover for immediate 14 complete days after insured event. No other waiting periods specified.
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Claims must be reported as soon as reasonably possible and no later than 30 days from discovery. Theft/malicious damage must be reported to police IMMEDIATELY upon discovery.
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: 30 days from discovery to notify insurer. Police notification for theft/malicious damage: immediate.
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever later) for full refund, unless claim made or incident occurred

common_questions.question: Do I need any other insurance for this policy to be valid?
common_questions.answer: YES - CRITICAL. You MUST have a valid annual Property Policy in place for the entire Period of Insurance. This policy is designed to work ALONGSIDE your existing Property Policy, not replace it. You must also inform your Property Policy provider within 30 days that you are doing short-term letting.
common_questions.section_reference: Eligibility section, General Policy Conditions section 9

common_questions.question: When must I purchase this policy - before or after guests arrive?
common_questions.answer: BEFORE. Cover must be in place BEFORE guests arrive. The policy is only valid during a Valid Booking and you must ensure cover is in force for the entire occupancy period of your guest's stay.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Conditions section 2, About this policy

common_questions.question: Does this policy cover COVID-19 related claims?
common_questions.answer: NO. There is a complete exclusion for Communicable Disease including COVID-19 and all other coronaviruses and pandemics. This exclusion applies to all sections and overrides everything else in the policy.

common_questions.question: What if the guest paid a deposit - how does that affect my claim?
common_questions.answer: You must retain the full deposit paid by the guest. If the deposit equals or exceeds the claim value, there is no cover. If the deposit exceeds the policy excess, the amount exceeding the excess will be deducted from any claim settlement.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Conditions section 1, How much we will pay section

common_questions.question: My guest's dog damaged the sofa - is this covered?
common_questions.answer: NO. There is a specific exclusion for damage caused by domestic pets including chewing, scratching, tearing and fouling.

common_questions.question: How quickly must I report a claim?
common_questions.answer: As soon as reasonably possible and no later than 30 days from discovery. For theft or malicious damage, you must also report to police IMMEDIATELY and get a crime reference number.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Conditions section 1, How to Make a Claim

common_questions.question: Can I claim if items were stolen but I don't have the receipts?
common_questions.answer: NO. For theft claims, you cannot claim for items where host ownership cannot be proven by presentation of a receipt.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 2 Contents - What is not Covered (Theft)

common_questions.question: My property needs £10,000 of building work - can I still have guests staying?
common_questions.answer: NO. No guests can stay if there are any renovations or structural alterations including extensions taking place. This is a condition of the policy.

common_questions.question: What's the maximum number of guests I can have?
common_questions.answer: Less than 20 people (maximum 10 adults and 10 children) staying at your property at any one time.

common_questions.question: My property was damaged by multiple guests during one booking - how many excesses do I pay?
common_questions.answer: Only ONE excess. Multiple instances of loss or damage during a single Valid Booking are treated as a single incident, so only one excess applies (the higher of any excesses due).

common_questions.question: Does this cover my normal property insurance risks when I'm not hosting?
common_questions.answer: NO. This policy only covers claims arising as a direct result of Hosting Activity during a Valid Booking. Your annual Property Policy continues to cover risks when not hosting. Claims that would be covered under your Property Policy if this policy didn't exist are excluded.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Exclusions section 6, About this policy

common_questions.question: A guest left the tap on and flooded the property - is this covered?
common_questions.answer: YES, if it occurred during a Valid Booking. Escape of water caused by a guest is covered up to £1,000,000 (or £50,000 for flats) with a £100 excess.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1a/1b - What is Covered (Escape of water)

common_questions.question: Can I claim for loss of earnings while repairs are done?
common_questions.answer: YES, but only for bookings made BEFORE the insured event, and NOT for the first 14 complete days after the event. Maximum £10,000 per claim. You must have written contractual agreement of the booking before the event.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 3 - Loss of income following a claim

common_questions.question: My guest is threatening to sue me - am I covered?
common_questions.answer: Potentially YES under Section 5 Liability to Others (up to £5,000,000) if their claim is for accidental bodily injury or property damage arising from hosting activity. You must notify insurer immediately, provide all documents, and must NOT admit liability or negotiate. However, there are many exclusions including deliberate acts, food/drink provision, theft of guest property, and sporting equipment.

common_questions.question: What if I need to cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: Within 14 days: full refund unless claim made or incident occurred. After 14 days: no refund and all outstanding premiums become due. Insurer can also cancel with 14 days notice for valid reasons.
